comment: She is an amazing teacher. Her accent is a little hard to understand, but she has no problem explaining everything to you personally. Sit on the side of the room closer to the door, or you won't be able to see the screens when she teaches. Keep up with the assignments, this is an easy A.

Pre-lab quizzes, post lab quizzes, a final. 2 practical exams, 1 group research project with your own experiment.
She has a thick accent, but you get used to it after a class or two. 
Fun intro class, she answered questions quickly & walked through everything in class if you asked.
Sit in the front of the lab, or you won't be able to hear her!

She would always be quick to answer any questions you had and help as well. She does have a thick accent but you can still understand what she's saying. The work we needed to complete during labs were long but easy to follow through. I would recommend taking her lab course.

After a month, I stopped showing up to class and just sort of self-taught myself the material because her accent was very thick. It's not that hard once you lock in. 4 exams (lockdown browser in class), lowest replaced w/ final. She has caught a few students cheating during exams. Final grade is 75% exams, 20% HW, and 5% in-class assignments.

Dr. Cadinu is one of the nicest and caring professors i have had in KSU. She takes time to answer my question in class and after class. She does have an accent but she is very knowlegeble on what she teaches. Her tests are not difficult if you can to class everyday, participate, and study. I definitely recommend taking her class!

This is hands down one of the best professors I've had. Whenever I had a question she would be quick to respond and gave such detailed explanations. She made sure you understood the topic and the exams were like the reviews and problem sets. highly recommend. she made learning enjoyable and I looked forward to coming to class everyday.

Her accent makes her difficult to understand but the class is rly straightforward. I don't regret taking her at all. She is so kind and also drops all the lowest grades which is insanely helpful. There are pre and post lab quizzes that are clear and the group projects are simple and don't take a lot of time. You wont regret taking her!

She is one of the nicest and sweetest professors! She is very understanding and knowledgeable. She helped me a lot, and she wants you to pass. It's honestly an easy class. There are pre- and post-lab quizzes that are usually five questions, and they are super easy. I definitely recommend it.

She does a great job at answering any questions you may have, and she also makes sure you really understand what she's explaining. She also explains the power points and the images on there, as long as you pay attention and come to class you should be fine. Tests aren't bad and very similar to the practice test and homework.

The tests are heavily dependent on the written/essay section, which was really annoying. The smartworks homework wasn't bad. In class assignments were graded unfairly, even if we attended and wrote down what she said in class I would still get points docked off. Heavy accent, hard to understand. She is not very lenient.

Has a very strong, very heavy Italian accent and talks very fast if you think you can learn through that then take this class. Absolutely does not care about your grade, and will deduct points off test unnecessarily.

you only have to get an 88 to end with an A and a 78 to end with a B. Class really isnt that bad, read the textbook and youll be fine. There are inclass assignments, practice tests, smartwork hw, and problem sets to study and most of the time she pulls a couple questions from them. she also adds bonus questions on the exams.
